Class StreamedStringSerializer

java.lang.Object

public final class StreamedStringSerializer
extends Object

UTF-8 String serialization

Author:
David Yu
Date created:
Feb 4, 2010

Method Summary
static LinkedBuffer writeAscii(String str, WriteSession session, OutputStream out, LinkedBuffer lb)
          Writes the ascii bytes from the string into the LinkedBuffer.

          Writes the stringified double into the LinkedBuffer.

          Writes the stringified float into the LinkedBuffer.

          Writes the stringified int into the LinkedBuffer.
static LinkedBuffer writeLong(long value, WriteSession session, OutputStream out, LinkedBuffer lb)
          Writes the stringified long into the LinkedBuffer.
static LinkedBuffer writeUTF8(String str, WriteSession session, OutputStream out, LinkedBuffer lb)
          Writes the utf8-encoded bytes from the string into the LinkedBuffer.
static LinkedBuffer writeUTF8FixedDelimited(String str, boolean littleEndian, WriteSession session, OutputStream out, LinkedBuffer lb)
          The length of the utf8 bytes is written first before the string - which is fixed 2-bytes.
static LinkedBuffer writeUTF8FixedDelimited(String str, WriteSession session, OutputStream out, LinkedBuffer lb)
          The length of the utf8 bytes is written first (big endian) before the string - which is fixed 2-bytes.
static LinkedBuffer writeUTF8VarDelimited(String str, WriteSession session, OutputStream out, LinkedBuffer lb)
          The length of the utf8 bytes is written first before the string - which is a variable int (1 to 5 bytes).

writeAscii

public static LinkedBuffer writeAscii(String str,
                                      WriteSession session,
                                      OutputStream out,
                                      LinkedBuffer lb)
                               throws IOException
Writes the ascii bytes from the string into the LinkedBuffer. It is the responsibility of the caller to know in advance that the string is 100% ascii. E.g if you convert a double/float to a string, you are sure it only contains ascii chars.

Throws:
IOException

writeUTF8FixedDelimited

public static LinkedBuffer writeUTF8FixedDelimited(String str,
                                                   WriteSession session,
                                                   OutputStream out,
                                                   LinkedBuffer lb)
                                            throws IOException
The length of the utf8 bytes is written first (big endian) before the string - which is fixed 2-bytes. Same behavior as DataOutputStream.writeUTF(String).

Throws:
IOException

writeUTF8FixedDelimited

public static LinkedBuffer writeUTF8FixedDelimited(String str,
                                                   boolean littleEndian,
                                                   WriteSession session,
                                                   OutputStream out,
                                                   LinkedBuffer lb)
                                            throws IOException
The length of the utf8 bytes is written first before the string - which is fixed 2-bytes.

Throws:
IOException

writeUTF8VarDelimited

public static LinkedBuffer writeUTF8VarDelimited(String str,
                                                 WriteSession session,
                                                 OutputStream out,
                                                 LinkedBuffer lb)
                                          throws IOException
The length of the utf8 bytes is written first before the string - which is a variable int (1 to 5 bytes).

Throws:
IOException
